intro: Romulea hybrida, commonly known as the hybrid glory-of-the-snow, is a member of the Iridaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that produces showy, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, yellow, and orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Romulea hybrida is appreciated for its ornamental value and is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant, early spring blooms.
